metadata.title: CVE-2016-1550 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable vulnerability exists in the message authenticationfunctionality of libntp in ntp 4.2.8p4 and NTPSeca5fb34b9cc89b92a8fef2f459004865c93bb7f92. An attacker can send a series ofcrafted messages to attempt to recover the message digest key.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3').
